tweets.author_name: chai goth? CHAI goth? chai GOTH? chai goth...
tweets.html:
I feel like hanging out with Neil deGrasse Tyson would be stressful. I don't need that many facts in my life

— chai goth? CHAI goth? chai GOTH? chai goth... (@Abid_ism) July 13, 2015

Realised that Humans lost me when it gave narrative weight to gross teen son’s distress on losing the sexy servant robot to wank over.

— Faye Woods (@FayebellineW) July 13, 2015

BREAKING: Harper Lee has finished writing the sixth and seventh volumes of A Song of Ice and Fire.

— Phillip Maciak (@pjmaciak) July 13, 2015

"So, let's get down to it post-shotski. He's a racist, but was Atticus super hung?" - Andy Cohen interviewing Harper Lee on WWHL, probably

— itsonlyzach (@itsonlyzach) July 14, 2015

Hey what if True Detective was never good and we all just enjoy reading blogs?

— Bob Powers (@bobpowers1) July 13, 2015

Maybe TRUE DETECTIVE’s third season should be about Weird Twitter.

— Sam Adams (@SamuelAAdams) July 13, 2015

I do like that @TrueDetective finally answered the age-old question of who brings a knife to a gunfight.

— Drew Grant (@videodrew) July 13, 2015

I was asked in a job interview to explain what is happening in this season of True Detective and I 100% will not get that job.

— 'Tis The Treason! (@brockwilbur) July 13, 2015

Next on TRUE DETECTIVE: “Do you know the word ‘louche’? What about ‘prolix’? ‘Somnambulant’? ‘Chupacabra’?”

— Sam Adams (@SamuelAAdams) July 13, 2015

This week's lesson from True Detective: Ask your bar singer to play a happy song once in a while, geez. http://t.co/sUtR4ZLkqM

— Brian Grubb (@briancgrubb) July 13, 2015

Can True Detective season 3 just be Hannibal season 4?

— Brendan Hay (@B_Hay) July 13, 2015

KBC has decided that we will not be airing season 2 #TrueDetective in Kendrick household. Timeslot will be filled w/ TBA streaming content.

— Kel "Jingle Jangle Bells" K. (@TVKel) July 14, 2015

Really hoping there's a True Detective ep coming up where they run into Ray Donovan and get a coffee and talk about life, man

— Richard Lawson (@rilaws) July 14, 2015

This week's True Detective. Vince Vaughn: "Sometimes your worst self is your best self." Don't waste time on those second drafts, writers.

— Muffin MacGuffin🕯 (@MuffMacGuff) July 14, 2015

Whole idea of a "leaked" trailer is absurd. It's a finished trailer, not footage from something in process. STOP WATCHING OUR COMMERCIAL!!!

— Adam Sternbergh (@sternbergh) July 13, 2015

Can anyone get me an invite to the Lady Gaga/Taylor Kinney wedding and make sure I'm seated at the same table as Dick Wolf and Tony Bennett?

— Todd VanDerWerff (@tvoti) July 13, 2015

VERY angry that NBC moved #Hannibal to Saturdays. Now I gotta wait TWO extra days to add Gillian Anderson's outfits to my vision board.

— Richie (@RichieOnTV) July 14, 2015

I'm worried that NBC moving #Hannibal to Saturdays bodes ill for the future of that show. #CancelBear

— Daniel Walters (@danieltwalters) July 13, 2015

In moving Aquarius to Saturday night, NBC is literally burning off the first season of a show it renewed three weeks ago. That's a new one.

— Anthony Crupi (@crupicrupicrupi) July 13, 2015

I genuinely believe that Matt Dillon's character had many concussions in his youth. Genuinely. #WaywardPines

— Dennis Perkins (@DennisPerkins5) July 14, 2015

I've been watching Wayward Pines and I have questions. Mostly they all boil down to ...WHAT?

— battling bard 🎄❄️ (@katetocci) July 14, 2015

Going on a first date is really just you explaining a Previously On to someone before the new episode of You.

— radio friendly unit Spenser (@spensersnothere) July 14, 2015

No ever said: Hey I have an idea--Ally McBeal and Indiana Jones fanfic. Solid.

— Danielle Nussbaum (@daniellenuss) July 14, 2015

We're all on board that Michael B. Jordan deserves all the massive stardom he's about to have, right? Catchup: #FridayNightLights

— Dennis Perkins (@DennisPerkins5) July 14, 2015

Why is Berman's hair green? Is he part of the Suicide Squad? pic.twitter.com/lF37vnbvlG

— Mike Tunison (@xmasape) July 14, 2015

Since when did Chris Berman start sporting the #oompaloompmullet ??? #HRDerby

— ChristianZ (@cerealtor) July 14, 2015

Chris Berman looks like John Clayton from that SportsCenter ad where he's a metalhead living in his mom's house.

— Jason Wojciechowski (@jlwoj) July 14, 2015

Good to see ESPN is also letting some of those kids in the outfield run camera and direct the #HRDerby

— Crutnacker (@Crutnacker) July 14, 2015

The people complaining about the camera situation need to understand that this is the first televised baseball event from Cincinnati

— Jason Wojciechowski (@jlwoj) July 14, 2015

I think Todd Frazier knew what pitches were coming... #HRDerby

— Eric Stangel (@EricStangel) July 14, 2015

I want Berman to live forever and eventually be made almost entirely of Bender-type robot parts

— BUM CHILLUPS (@edsbs) July 14, 2015

Chris Berman only knows five words: "BACK BACK BACK", "GONE", and "Whoop"

— The Shredder (@Shred42) July 14, 2015

I'm afraid Chris Berman might stroke out on live television #HRDerby

— Jazzmine Butler (@TheSuperMilf) July 14, 2015

@.seangentille The Home Run Derby is a tribute to monstrosities of human beings. For that reason, Chris Berman is a perfect man for the job.

— Born Black & Gold (@BornBlacknGold) July 14, 2015

Chris berman is living proof that one person can completely ruin something.

— Derrick Eskra (@extra_eskra2) July 14, 2015

Someone needs to explain to Chris Berman that some of the phrases he uses like "upper decker" have alternate meanings. #GetHimUrbanDictonary

— Brian Scott Rippee (@bsrippee) July 14, 2015

The best thing about the timed format in the #HRDerby is that it gives Chris Berman less time to talk.

— Kevin Allen (@kevlallen) July 14, 2015

I think I finally cracked the code on the inspiration of the Chris Berman hairstyle. pic.twitter.com/znZ0oBEGYs

— munistadium (@munistadium) July 14, 2015

The Chris Berman Mullet- business in the front, party in the back back back. #HRDerby

— Brent Smith (@B_Smith83) July 14, 2015

The best thing about Chris Berman is how excited he gets when a baseball goes over the outfield fence during a thing called HOME RUN DERBY.

— Anthony Crupi (@crupicrupicrupi) July 14, 2015

REAL TALK: These outfield kids are terrible

— Dan Hopper (@DanHopp) July 14, 2015

Even time limits can’t make the Home Run Derby run on-time.

— Daniel Fienberg (@d_fienberg) July 14, 2015

Next year: Home Run TARDIS. All time problems solved. #HomeRunDerby

— Ryan McGee (@TVMcGee) July 14, 2015

Chris Berman has run out of things to say. I think he's just flipping through a crossword dictionary now. #HRDerby

— Crutnacker (@Crutnacker) July 14, 2015

That moment between Champ Pederson and Pujols made the whole Home Run Derby worthwhile.

— Daniel Fienberg (@d_fienberg) July 14, 2015

A baseball must have done something awful to Joc Pederson once. He is out for revenge against all baseballkind.

— Emma Span (@emmaspan) July 14, 2015

“These timeouts are unbelievable, aren’t they!” - Actual thing Chris Berman just crowed.

— Daniel Fienberg (@d_fienberg) July 14, 2015

Just like playing Home Run Derby in the backyard in childhood, hoping to capitalize on the 30 second bonus round!

— Daniel Fienberg (@d_fienberg) July 14, 2015

Ok, Home run derby. You're back.

— Jobu (@Jobu_Lives) July 14, 2015

I’m so upset at myself for not realizing that combining dingers and buzzer beaters was a terrific idea.

— Brian Grubb (@briancgrubb) July 14, 2015

Perhaps baseball could use a clock, after all.

— Jamil Smith (@JamilSmith) July 14, 2015

It's patently wrong for any show to be written so that I'm upset to see Alex Saxon. #TheFosters

— Holly Jolly Christmas (@hollye83) July 14, 2015

Brandon and Sophia create a vortex of The Worst. #TheFosters

— Holly Jolly Christmas (@hollye83) July 14, 2015

WHY IS THIS BRANDON AND SOPHIA THING HAPPENING. #TheFosters

— Holly Jolly Christmas (@hollye83) July 14, 2015

BRANDON IS THE WORRRRRRRRRRST #TheFosters

— Carrie Raisler (@TVandDinners) July 14, 2015

WHY IS WYATT BEING THE WORST NOW. WHAT IS HAPPENING. #TheFosters

— Holly Jolly Christmas (@hollye83) July 14, 2015

Wyatt, no matter how glorious your hair is, you don't get to act this way. #TheFosters

— melissa miller (@Serrae) July 14, 2015

Covering "Zoo," "Under The Dome," and "BH90210" this summer means the note I type the most is "like a GD idiot."

— Tara Ariano (@TaraAriano) July 14, 2015

What if a premium cable drama wasn't about conflicted men

— Richard Lawson (@rilaws) July 14, 2015

I'd like to think that the overly serious way Corey Stoll says "previously on #TheStrain" is due to the wig glue.

— Kel "Jingle Jangle Bells" K. (@TVKel) July 14, 2015

I really like UnReal, but they could have gotten through at least two seasons of moral dilemmas without straight up killing someone.

— Miriam Krule (@miriamkrule) July 14, 2015

UnREAL: this-is-not-your-fault-sex

— Brandon 🚷 (@bnowalk) July 14, 2015

All I want to do is talk about #UnREALtv for the foreseeable future

— Jarett Wieselman (@JarettSays) July 14, 2015

"She's worth five crashed Ferraris." F--k yes, that monster is. #UnREAL

— tierney bricker (@tbrick2) July 14, 2015

I checked: it turns out you can watch and enjoy "UnREAL" without also making sure the world knows you don't watch reality TV.

— Tara Ariano (@TaraAriano) July 14, 2015

@TaraAriano but how????????

— Brian Grubb (@briancgrubb) July 14, 2015

@DangerGuerrero I know it seems nuts, but I really did check!

— Tara Ariano (@TaraAriano) July 14, 2015

@TaraAriano I’ll take your word for it but only because I know how committed you are to the integrity of your research

— Brian Grubb (@briancgrubb) July 14, 2015

UnREAL genuinely feels like a benevolent god heard our prayers for a dark cable drama that's not about a middle-aged white man 💯

— Muffin MacGuffin🕯 (@MuffMacGuff) July 14, 2015

We just watched yesterday's #UnREALtv. It's weird loving a show that just makes you feel bad. Just bad. Like let's all take showers now bad.

— Irascibly Ornery Dr. KW (@kristenwarner) July 14, 2015

To recap: Kaitlyn and Nick have been intimate! Shawn is unhappy! Kaitlyn is unhappy that Shawn is unhappy! WE GET IT. #thebachelorette

— Jennifer Weiner (@jenniferweiner) July 14, 2015

tweets.author_name: Austin Morris, Real Housewife of Madison
tweets.html:
"Calming presence" has never not been code for "I'm bored" on this show. See you on The Bachelor, Ben H! #Bachelorette

— Austin Morris, Real Housewife of Madison (@austindotTV) July 14, 2015

tweets.author_name: Austin Morris, Real Housewife of Madison
tweets.html:
So. much. sweater. porn. #TheBachelorette

— Austin Morris, Real Housewife of Madison (@austindotTV) July 14, 2015

tweets.author_name: Austin Morris, Real Housewife of Madison
tweets.html:
K but Jillian's black bar was much smaller last season. I'm just saying. #TheBachelorette

— Austin Morris, Real Housewife of Madison (@austindotTV) July 14, 2015

I love this eskimo brother beef because it seems totally lost on both Nick and Shawn that THEY are in fact eskimo brothers. #TheBachelorette

— Lauren Chval (@lchval) July 14, 2015

Shawn is a morning after pill #TheBachelorette

— Dana Weiss (@Possessionista) July 14, 2015

"I don't care if I never talk to you again for the rest of my life!" My 7-year-old has better fights with stuffed animals. #thebachelorette

— Jennifer Weiner (@jenniferweiner) July 14, 2015

Bravo to #thebachelorette producers for this extended segment of Pacing While Pissed. Whoa. #thebachelorette

— Jennifer Weiner (@jenniferweiner) July 14, 2015

They should lock Shawn and Nick in a closet listening to the HamsterDance until they bond like in a sorority #TheBachelorette

— Us Weekly (@usweekly) July 14, 2015

Kaitlyn just played the most brutal round of Fuck, Marry, Kill #TheBachelorette @Possessionista

— Annie (@talk_2_annie) July 14, 2015

Utah? Kaitlyn will meet her loves' families not at some posh tropical paradise but in...Utah? Who did she piss off? #thebachelorette

— Jennifer Weiner (@jenniferweiner) July 14, 2015

"This is my brother Darryl. And this is my other brother Darryl." -Nick #TheBachelorette

— Us Weekly (@usweekly) July 14, 2015

Nick's family is "surprised" there are only two. And by "surprised" I mean "really furious that they're not in St. Lucia." #thebachelorette

— Jennifer Weiner (@jenniferweiner) July 14, 2015

“You have raised a stallion of a lover, despite his puppet-like features.” —What I need Kaitlyn to say to Nick’s mom.

— Damian Holbrook (@damianholbrook) July 14, 2015

Nick's mom asks what we're all thinking -- how is this different from when you brought Andi home? HMMM. #thebachelorette

— Jennifer Weiner (@jenniferweiner) July 14, 2015

"She's great at making out." Who says that to their mother!?!? Did I move to Crazytown? #thebachelorette

— Jennifer Weiner (@jenniferweiner) July 14, 2015

And now, Kaitlyn and Nick will kiss until they forget that they are in Utah. I mean. Not even Miami? Cape Cod? Nothing? #thebachelorete

— Jennifer Weiner (@jenniferweiner) July 14, 2015

"Is Shawn ready for marriage?" I don't know, but he's sure ready to pound the crap out of Nick. #thebachelorette

— Jennifer Weiner (@jenniferweiner) July 14, 2015

I was hoping all of Shawn's family was going to be wearing crop tops. #TheBachelorette

— Us Weekly (@usweekly) July 14, 2015

The guys care so much. Kaitlyn cares so much. The families care so much. But I'm kinda eh... #TheBachelorette

— Us Weekly (@usweekly) July 14, 2015

"Gaze long into the abyss, and the abyss gazes into you." - Nietzsche, live-tweeting The Bachelorette

— Ronan Farrow (@RonanFarrow) July 14, 2015

Ireland's tourism play with #TheBachelorette has backfired. 487 episodes in, it might as well be Rhode Island.

— Michael O'Connell (@mikeylikestv) July 14, 2015

*in Bachelorette fantasy suite*

Now that we're alone I need to show you something.

*finds Saved By The Bell oil spill episode on YouTube*

— Jensen Karp (@JensenClan88) July 14, 2015

At some point, you stop blaming the people on #TheBachelorette and start blaming their shitty friends who were like, "Yes! Be on TV! Do it!"

— Zac Hug (@zachug) July 14, 2015
